reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a fantastic place to stay in Venice. The location can't be any better - an easy walk to almost everything. The facility itself has been completely updated. What separates this hotel is the service. Matteo is an active owner who feels no request is too much. His fine staff (Oliver, David, Thomas, et. al) follow his lead and provide a sense that you are friends, not guests. They all know your name from the moment you arrive.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From a great breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge, to a network of fine restaurants, this hotel is like a second home. Sitting on the terrace late in the afternoon with a spritz makes you wonder why you would even consider any other hotel in Venice (except their sister property Locanda Orseolo).
reviews.title: Make you feel like royalty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot rave about this hotel enough, but as gorgeous as the palace, rooms, and views are...it is the staff that really makes it the best hotel in Venice and one of the best in the world! Everyone knows you and calls you by name, and they take genuine pleasure in catering to your every desire and more. We truly felt like royalty! Matteo and Oliver were absolutely fabulous, and they gave us wonderful recommendations for "native" restaurants and sites. We felt like old friends within minutes of meeting them, and we so enjoyed talking to them. The same family also owns the Locanda Orseolo in Venice, which has equally fabulous service...just slightly more moderate accomodations (and prices), and the location is near St. Mark's vs. on the Grand Canal. If the Al Ponte Antico is full, stay at the Locanda Orseolo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor I was confident the hotel would be what we were looking for. The many great reviews still do not do this hotel justice. The hotel is beautiful and charming, location is fantastic and the service is absolutely impeccable. Having stayed in many hotels in Europe I have never experienced service and hospitality as that at the Al Ponte Antico. I could not recommend this hotel enough, with only nine rooms you are looked upon as individuals, not room numbers. The staff are so friendly, I guarantee you will not get a hotel experience like this anywhere. Don't stay anywhere else, this hotel is simply The Best.
reviews.title: The Al Ponte Antico is a very special hotel

reviews.title: Best hotel experience ever - look no further!
reviews.text: Well, where to start? From being greeted by name by all the staff upon first arriving by water taxi at the private water gate, to the beautifully furnished room and the ridiculously scenic views of the Rialto bridge and Grand Canal from the terrace where we ate the owner's fantastic fresh omelettes every morning (eggs from his grandmother's farm - obviously!) and drank at least one of the night watchman's (Thommaso) fabulous Spritzers every evening, this hotel has literally everything you could dream of for a fantastic stay in Venice - and that's before you get onto the customer service. We were daft enough to misbook our flights home and only found out the night before. When we decided it was cheaper to stay in Venice for 3 more nights than book new flights, Matteo and staff couldn't have been more helpful. They moved us to the best room in the hotel at the same rate as our other room for the next 2 nights, then booked us into their sister hotel (also very good) & transferred our luggage there for the final night. They even laundered all our clothes for free so we could last out the week. Our best hotel experience, ever, by far. We're going to recommend to our kids that they spend their honeymoons there! Thank you Matteo for a completely magical experience!

We recently returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy. We spent 3 nights in Venice and stayed at the Al Ponte Antico Hotel. This hotel had received good reviews in the forums and I would like to provide another.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the location of this hotel and thought it optimal for staying in Venice. The hotel is on the Grand Canal near the Rialto Bridge. I had read some forums recommending staying off the Grand Canal due to noise. However, I think the positive aspects of staying on the Grand Canal outweigh any negative. Our room had windows opening onto the canal and there was some noise from the water traffic, but this is nothing like that of a motor highway. The room was insulated enough from noise at night and we were willing to put up with a little noise to be able to look out onto the Grand Canal whenever we wanted. Being on the Grand Canal also allows for direct transfers to and from the hotel by water taxi and eliminates lugging bags through the streets. The Hotel has a great view of the Rialto Bridge, but is a far enough walk away from the bridge, which is one of the more crowded areas in Venice. The central location allows easy access to all parts of the city either on foot or waterway.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel Magical View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Al Ponte Antico for 2 nights prior to a cruise. I booked this hotel a year in advance and the anticipation of staying there exceeded my expectations which were high to begin with. The deservingly proud owner, Matteo, greeted us warmly by name and showed us our room which was a suite on the first floor. Our room was a little above water level and I felt that I had a front seat view for all the wonders of Venice. Gondolas drifted by right in front of us and other boat traffic went about their everyday business. I liked the location very much. I felt it had more of a neighborhood feel then the area around St. Mark's.
reviews.title: The perfect start to a wonderful vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The newly renovated breakfast room was gorgeous with an enormous shiny brass espresso, cappuccino machine which made the best coffees. The buffet breakfast with the chocolate banana crepes was a great way to start the day. Drinking my new favorite drink, the spritz, on the terrace and watching the boat traffic was a relaxing way to end our days.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back again -

reviews.text: Everyone who worked at the Al Ponte Antico went over and beyond trying to please us. They were a happy bunch of people who always had a smile on their faces. I hope the Al Ponte Antico gets kicked up to the #1 spot on tripadvisor. It deserves to be there and more.
reviews.title: the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say that has not been said before, after meeting Matteo in 2007 and having drinks on the terrace (we were staying at their sister hotel) we knew we had to come back and stay with Matteo. Arriving in a water taxi we unloaded our bags and Matteo was there to great us like the old friends we felt we were. We had a wonderful suite (apparently the best in the house) with a very large bedroom, separate lounge/desk area and with two huge windows that opened out onto the water of the Grand Canal. Whilst the bathroom was small, it was very modern and sufficient and the additional space in the suite more than compensated for it. The rooms were clean and the staff were all wonderful, the breakfasts delicious, with the eggs coming from Matteo's grandmothers farm and sitting on the balcony having breakfast in the mornings looking out on the the Grand Canal or drinks in the evening before going for dinner and then back for a nightcap, this was one of the highlights of Venice for us. Our third trip to Venice and staying with Matteo was like staying with a very good friend, but with five star service. A smaller hotel where the guests mingled with each other in the evening on the terrace (if you wished to do so) and there is no other place that we would consider staying in Venice in fact any time we are in Europe it would be a must stop. Cannot recommend this hotel or their sister one enough. Its worth a trip to Venice to stay with these wonderful people in their wonderful "home".
reviews.title: Wonderful!
